channel.title: SGU - 标签 - 寸方斋

item.title: SGU 118 - Digital Root
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description Let $f(n)$ be a sum of digits for positive integer $n$. If $f(n)$ is one-digit number then it is a digital root for $n$ and otherwise digital root of $n$ is equal to digital root of $f(n)$. For example, digital root of 987 is 6. Your task is to find digital root for expression $$ A_1\cdot A_2\cdots A_N + A_1\cdot A_2\cdots A_{N-1} + \cdots + A_1\cdot A_2 + A_1$$

item.title: SGU 117 - Counting
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description Find amount of numbers for given sequence of integer numbers such that after raising them to the $M$-th power they will be divided by $K$. Input Input consists of two lines. There are three integer numbers $N, M, K$ ($0<N, M, K<10001$) on the first line. There are N positive integer numbers − given sequence (each number is not more than 10001) − on the second line. Output Write

item.title: SGU 104 - Little shop of flowers
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description You want to arrange the window of your flower shop in a most pleasant way. You have $F$ bunches of flowers, each being of a different kind, and at least as many vases ordered in a row. The vases are glued onto the shelf and are numbered consecutively 1 through $V$, where $V$ is the number of vases, from left to right so that the vase 1 is the

item.title: SGU 101 - Domino
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description Dominoes – game played with small, rectangular blocks of wood or other material, each identified by a number of dots, or pips, on its face. The blocks usually are called bones, dominoes, or pieces and sometimes men, stones, or even cards. The face of each piece is divided, by a line or ridge, into two squares, each of which is marked as would be a pair of dice… The

item.title: SGU 347 - Join the Strings
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description His Royal Highness King of Berland Berl XV was a very wise man and had a very accomplished wife, who was aware of the fact, that prominent and outstanding personalities once having written down their names on the pages of glorious History, remain there forever. His Royal Highness King Berl XV experienced an intrinsic, lost nowadays, deep and sincere sense of respect and trust for his beloved spouse. So

item.title: SGU 151 - Construct a triangle
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description Find coordinates of any $\triangle ABC$ if it is know that $|AB|=c$, $|AC|=b$, $|AM|=m$, $AM$ is a median of triangle. Input There are three real numbers in input: $c$, $b$, $m$ ($0<c, b, m\leq 10^3$) separated by a space. Length of the fractional part of each number is not greater than 2 digits. Output If solution exists, write three lines. Write coordinates of point $A$ to first line, coordinates

item.title: SGU 180 - Inversions
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description There are $N$ integers ($1\leq N\leq 65537$) $A_1, A_2,\cdots, A_N$ ($0\leq A_i\leq 10^9$). You need to find amount of such pairs $(i, j)$ that $1\leq i < j\leq N$ and $A[i]>A[j]$. Input The first line of the input contains the number $N$. The second line contains $N$ numbers $A_1,\cdots,A_N$. Output Write amount of such pairs. Sample Input 1 2 5 2 3 1 5 4 Sample Output 1 3

item.title: SGU 127 - Telephone directory
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description CIA has decided to create a special telephone directory for its agents. The first 2 pages of the directory contain the name of the directory and instructions for agents, telephone number records begin on the third page. Each record takes exactly one line and consists of 2 parts: the phone number and the location of the phone. The phone number is 4 digits long. Phone numbers cannot start with

item.title: SGU 112 - a^b - b^a
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description You are given natural numbers $a$ and $b$. Find $a^b - b^a$. Input Input contains numbers $a$ and $b$ ($1\leq a,b\leq 100$). Output Write answer to output. Sample Input 1 2 3 Sample Output 1 -1 Analysis 非常明显的高精度，再观察一下样例，要处理减法，而且有负数，注意一

item.title: SGU 113 - Nearly prime numbers
item.author: 作者
item.description: Description Nearly prime number is an integer positive number for which it is possible to find such primes $P_1$ and $P_2$ that given number is equal to $P_1\cdot P_2$. There is given a sequence on $N$ integer positive numbers, you are to write a program that prints “Yes” if given number is nearly prime and “No” otherwise. Input Input file consists of $N + 1$ numbers. First is positive integer
